dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4732 IH: Promoting Health Careers in Community and Technical Colleges Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Doggett introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To ensure that health professions opportunity demonstration projects train project participants to earn a recognized postsecondary credential, and to clarify that community colleges are eligible for grants to conduct such a demonstration project.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Health Careers in Community and Technical Colleges Act.

section.header: Health professions opportunity demonstration project grantees required to train project participants to earn a recognized postsecondary credential
section.text: Section 2008 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397g) is amended by redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (d) and (e), respectively, and by inserting after subsection (b) the following:

subsection.header: Grantees required To train project participants To earn a recognized postsecondary credential
subsection.text: An eligible entity awarded a grant to conduct a demonstration project under this section shall train project participants to earn a recognized postsecondary credential, including an industry-recognized credential.

section.header: Eligibility of community colleges for grants to conduct health professions opportunity demonstration projects
section.text: Section 2008(a)(4)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397g(a)(4)(D)) is amended by striking section 101 and inserting sections 101 and 102(a)(1)(B).
The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on October 1, 2023.
